title: Sir Lawrence Alma-Tadema's Library in Townshend House, London
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Sotheby's London, Wednesday June 5, 1991 (Victorian Paintings, Drawings and Watercolours, lot 341; The Fine Art Society, London; Jeremy Cooper Limited, London
medium: Brush and watercolor and gouache, pen and ink, graphite on white paper
description: The library interior shows elements of the Aesthetic Movement.  The furniture, including a fur-covered couch, bentwood chairs, and a bamboo armchair and writing table, located in the neighboring room on the left, is utilitarian.  The use of tiles on either side of the stained glass windows and of geometric-patterned walls are design components often seen in late nineteenth century England.
name: Drawing
